description: Deepdale Train TrestleThis is a short hike to a large trestle bridge close to Inverness.  The bridge was built in 1931 and is still standing strong.  It is now part of a multi activity rails to rail systems.  Because the rail line has very little height changes, it is a hike suitable for anybody.
directions: Inverness, Cape Breton Island.  On central Ave (highway 19), the trail to rails can be accessed near the old Deepdale Rd; 46°13'30.26"N, 61°18'35.67"W.
title: Deepdale Train trestle
